comments:
using I20050118 build

If you load a "bogus" Project like org.eclipse.core.runtime.osgi, you will get
the following exception below.

WorkspaceModelManager.loadModel forces WorkspaceBundleModel.load() which fails
since there is no MANIFEST.MF, therefore the Bundle.fProperties is null.

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.bundle.Bundle.getHeader(Bundle.java:38)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.bundle.BundleModel.isFragmentModel(BundleModel.java:46)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.WorkspaceModelManager.createWorkspaceBundleModel(WorkspaceModelManager.java:561)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.WorkspaceModelManager.createPluginModel(WorkspaceModelManager.java:509)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.WorkspaceModelManager.addWorkspaceModel(WorkspaceModelManager.java:603)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.WorkspaceModelManager.handleFileAdded(WorkspaceModelManager.java:225)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.WorkspaceModelManager.handleFileChanged(WorkspaceModelManager.java:271)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.WorkspaceModelManager.handleFileDelta(WorkspaceModelManager.java:216)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.WorkspaceModelManager.visit(WorkspaceModelManager.java:454)
        at

        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.WorkspaceModelManager.handleResourceDelta(WorkspaceModelManager.java:432)
        at
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.WorkspaceModelManager.resourceChanged(WorkspaceModelManager.java:393)
        at

        at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.DeltaProcessingState.resourceChanged(DeltaProcessingState.java:403)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$2.run(NotificationManager.java:283)
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:1061)

Created an attachment (id=17320)
Check for null

Just checking for a null fProperties is safer and easier.
